definition.name: RootDocument
definition.purpose: Provides the root HTML document structure and layout for the app
definition.description: A layout component that wraps the application in a standard HTML document structure, including <html>, <head>, and <body> tags. It injects Tanstack Router's HeadContent and Scripts, and renders the current route's content via children.

children.description: The content to render inside the document body, typically the current route's component tree.

when.description: A route is matched and rendered
when.event: Route content is rendered as children

visible: HTML structure with route content in body

effects: The current route's component tree is rendered inside the document body

definition.visualLayout: Standard HTML document with head and body. HeadContent injects meta tags and links. Body contains the route content and Scripts.
definition.implementationNotes: Used as the root layout for all routes. Integrates Tanstack Router's HeadContent and Scripts for SSR/CSR.

definition.name: Route
definition.purpose: Root route layout for the application, providing global head tags and wrapping all routes in the RootDocument
definition.description: Defines the root route for the Tanstack Router app. Sets up global meta tags, favicon, font links, and CSS. Renders the RootDocument layout and the current route's Outlet.

visible: Global meta tags and links in <head>

to.state: Root layout with nested route content
visible: RootDocument with nested route content in Outlet

effects: Nested route's component tree is rendered inside the Outlet

definition.visualLayout: RootDocument wrapping an Outlet. Head tags and links are set globally.
definition.implementationNotes: Uses Tanstack Router's createRootRouteWithContext for context injection. Head tags and links are set for the entire app.
